intro: Bismalva alcea, commonly known as common mallows, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features broad, heart-shaped leaves with a soft, velvety texture. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a central column of stamens. Bismalva alcea is often found in moist soils along stream banks and in wet meadows.
